wikipedia_page.main: William Alexander Kennedy Paterson (25 February 1930 – 9 November 2002) was a Scottish footballer, who played as a defender.

response: William Paterson or Bill Paterson may refer to:
* Bill Paterson (footballer, born 1897) (1897–1970), Scottish footballer for Cowdenbeath, Derby, Providence, New Bedford etc
* Bill Paterson (footballer, born 1930) (1930–2002), Scottish footballer for Doncaster, Newcastle, Rangers etc

Vincent McNeice (born 25 October 1938) is an English retired professional football centre half and manager who made over 230 appearances in the Football League for Watford. In 1965, he played in the Eastern Canada Professional Soccer League with Hamilton Primos. In his debut season with Hamilton he was selected to the league's all-star team, which faced Nottingham Forest F.C.. He also briefly served as a player-coach for Hamilton before Bill Paterson succeeded him.
